author: astroboysoup
title: CardanoPress: Governance Plugin
description: Technical knowledge is required to create a platform where users can vote on-chain. CardanoPress Governance plugin makes this process easy by integrating web2 features with on-chain voting.

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposer has provided a clear and concise description of the issue in their Problem Statement [Technical knowledge is required to create a platform where users can vote on-chain.] and the problem statement defines a problem within the challenge which needs to be solved [What tools can we provide to enable effective DAO's Creation & Operation].

The proposal is likely to have a positive impact on the Cardano ecosystem by being a go-to Governance solution for any WordPress user, and uses the KPIs set in the Challenge (Number of DAOs that use Cardano as governance/management chain in 6 months).

This proposal addresses the challenge effectively, so I rate IMPACT a 5/5.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposers provided a short description of who they are, including their roles and some past work. A team of 4 (WordPress & API Developer, Front End Dev and UX Designer + project owner) with the right skill set to work on this project and who have been developing WordPress solutions for the past 15 years.

The budget is outlined clearly, understandable, and broken down into identifiable items (Testing, Dev, UX design, Admin and documentation). The budget seems to be reasonable to achieve the set goals. The proposer provided a project roadmap, detailed in 6 phases however there is no timeline provided for each phase or project completion.

The only identified risk is the reliance on Blockfrost API and the team will reach out to Blockfrost API to mitigate that risk.

Given the experience and plan presented, it is very likely that this proposal will be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal provided a roadmap with milestones but not a time horizon for achievement. The project seems relatively simple and straightforward therefore tracking progress at each stages is not very critical, but an end date would have been welcomed. I rate auditability a 4/5.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal aims improve and scale a beta version of their plugin on-chain voting portal for deployment by DAOs based projects and other projects that needs on-chain voting system and governance structures. This is a great tool that will surely support and create an environment for DAO based projects flourish in Cardano and amongst other benefits for Cardano community as whole. The proposal definitely meets this challenge settings and should be supported accordingly.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal has not gotten sufficient information in respect of the team's profile. There is no details of core competence or experience in the space. The budgeting looks superficial and the roadmaps are vague and inconsistent without any reasonable timeline for evaluation of the project. This segment of the proposal is really insufficient for me to convincingly confirm the effective of the proposal.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal has provided sufficient and relevant information for the community to reasonably confirm the progress and development of the project. The metrics are verifiable and measurable, necessary basis for the community to effectively assess and monitor the success of the project.

f6_assessments.q0: It's great that this project provides a platform where users can vote on-chain. The CardanoPress admin plugin makes this process easy by integrating web2 features with on-chain voting. This project has completed the Beta phase and is in the operational phase. Here users can submit and discuss proposals, and then view and vote on proposals that have progressed across the entire chain. I completely agree that this proposal effectively solves the challenge for our ecosystem, Having this plugin makes it quick and easy to create an Admin portal. Can be deployed and started within minutes removing all barriers to entry.
f6_assessments.q1: There is a problem that the solution description fits the challenge, the concept of the proposal is reasonable, but the absence of a blueprint greatly affects the testability of the proposal. The proposal provides a plan consisting of 6 phases, in which we know what tasks will be performed. Unfortunately, it's not tied to timelines, so we can't imagine how long these phases will take, and when this project will start and end. Next on budget, the total required budget is $12,000 broken down into easily auditable chunks. However, according to my objective assessment, the salary of 150$/hour is quite high compared to other projects. And finally, introduce the project team of 4 members with a description of their role in the project. The track record of individuals involved in this proposal demonstrates their passion, affiliation, and willingness to make this project a success. This section will completely convince me if the roadmap is tied to specific milestones, so I agree with the feasibility of the proposal with a score of 4.
f6_assessments.q2:
There are several goals with well-defined KPIs such as the number of users and projects using the plugin for use in their projects.
- Number of users who joined us during development and then did our job and developed their success.
The success of the proposal is seen as projects installing and deploying the plugin as the voting platform of their choice. What's missing from this section is how the community can track this project. I have a suggestion that, at the end of each month, proponents give an overview, next to the goals achieved, as well as how their mode of operation. These reports can be provided in a simple document that the Cardano community should be made aware of through any of our means of communication, such as telegrams, discord, etc.

f6_assessments.q0:
On-chain governance portal that is easy to implement on wordpress website can be very userful for new and exiting DAOs on Cardano. It can lower the barrier for creating a DAOs and for improving governance proccesses.

Having this wordpress plugin for the Cardano blockchain can encourage DAOs to deploy on Cardano, and even to move to Cardano from other blockchains. As such this proposal addresses the DAOs <3 Cardao challenge and can contribute for achieving it goals - bringing more communities to engage in collaboration using Cardano as the infrastructure for their decision making and governance processes.
f6_assessments.q1:
I have been following Peter Bui youtube channel for a while now, and got the impression that he have a great knowledge about the Cardano ecosystem and is well known by the Cardano community. I see it as a significant advantage for the successes of the proposal and its chances to be implemented and be useful, as it can be helpful in creating awareness for the project and get trust by the community.

The fact that the team have already been building a beta version of the WP plugin also bring assurance for the success chances of the project, as they have proven delivering capability. I have checked the ADAWaifus Governance website example, and its looks very promising. From a quick glance it seems that most functionality are already in place, and with a better UI/UX it could be great tool for the use of DAOs and communities.
f6_assessments.q2: The budget is reasonable, the plan is detailed and suggest iteration's design and development process as needed in this kind of project. The only thing that is missing is a timeline for the six phases of the project. A timeline for milestones delivery is needed for tracking the project progress.

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal impacts the whole DAO community by providing a simple solution to allow voting from wordpress through a portal. Such a solution has a potential large impact for extending the outreach of Cardano Governance, as Wordpress has a market share of 43% of all websites. In short, every wordpress site owner can easily install the plugin object of the proposal, and enable voting. 

The proposal fits well in the challenge as the latter fosters both the creation of solutions to simplify governance and the increase of tools/frameworks for DAO Ops.
f6_assessments.q1:
Based on the experience of the team, the provided plan, the budget breakdown, and the existence of a working beta, I believe the proposed plan has a very high likelihood of success. 

The team has relevant and extensive experience in building Wordpress and Cardano Solutions. Most notably, the team developed a number of plugins that enable Wordpress integration with Cardano wallets.

The execution plan is clear and covers all the phases of the software development life cycle, starting from getting initial feedback, to development, and ending with producing documentation. 

The budget breakdown is synthetic but complete of estimated hours and hourly cost. The rate is high, but judging by the final price of the product and by the skills required to carry out the project, the cost is reasonable. 

Given there is already a working beta, it is reasonable that no implementation risk is mentioned. Anyway, the team shows attention to detail by outlining a runtime risk derived by a dependency on third party APIs.
f6_assessments.q2:
The community members can already test the plugin in beta, and can monitor the KPIs. However, the lack of delivery dates makes it harder for the community to check the progress. 

Since the public beta is already available, I consider installing and using the beta as a concrete form of audit that the community can perform. 

The team provides very clear KPIs to let the community know how to measure the success of the plugin: number of installations, and number of users engaging with the voting platform. 

The proposal does not mention any delivery date. Even in case the team considers the public beta already delivered, I would suggest providing a date signaling the community when the development efforts will be completed and when the product is available.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal is about Making a platform where users may directly vote on chains without even having technical understanding . The proposer has already created the CardanoPress Governance Beta plugin, which enables users to vote on chains without even having a technical background. A governance portal can be quickly and easily built using the CardanoPress Governance plugin. All entry issues are removed when something could be implemented and started quickly.he proposal outlines an issue that needs to be solved.The proposal clearly adds value to the cardano eco system.Upon reviewing the proposal The key metrices and goals of the proposal align with the outlined challenge settings.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposer have provided a detailed plan, including timeline and key milestones for implementing the proposal. The proposal will have 6 Phases  . The proposer have provided breakdown of each phase in the description . 
The timeline provided by the proposal looks very realistic and the Budget breakdown of the proposal is mentioned in very descriptive way and The proposer have also mentioned the details of the team who will be working on implementing this proposal and also mentioned the skills needed to implement. The proposal have also considered the challenges and the risks for successful implementation of project . Upon reviewing the proposal I strongly agree that the proposal is likely to be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2:
The progress of the proposal can be measured by looking KPI's the number of users and projects that take up the plugin to use in their own projects and by measuring and tracking how many users engage with with proposer during development and then take our work and successfully develop their own .The proposer have provided the clear understandable description of the challenge and The approach for the successful implementation is described. 
The Metrices/Kpi's mentioned in the proposal define the success of the proposal.

solution: We can take out the technical aspects of creating a portal where users can discuss and vote on various proposals created by a community and vote on them directly on-chain. We have a BETA version ready
experience:
The team working on CardanoPress have been developing WordPress solutions for 15 years. Using WordPress & corresponding technologies, we've delivered API solutions for clients worldwide.
Recently, we've delivered WordPress/Cardano solutions for projects building on Cardano.
